meanings.definition: More kingly in character or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The lion looked kinglier than the other animals in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: He acted kinglier than his friends, always showing grace and nobility.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was kinglier than the dog, demanding to be served first at dinner.
meanings.sent4: The majestic castle on the hill stood kinglier than any other building in the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: Her kinglier demeanor made everyone respect and admire her leadership.

meanings.definition: In a manner befitting a king.
meanings.sent1: He walked kinglier than anyone else, with a regal air about him.
meanings.sent2: She spoke kinglier than expected, commanding attention with every word.
meanings.sent3: The child pretended to rule the playground, strutting around kinglier than the other kids.
meanings.sent4: The sun set kinglier than ever before, painting the sky in shades of gold and pink.
meanings.sent5: The music played kinglier than usual, filling the room with a sense of grandeur.
